intro: Ternstroemia maltbya, commonly known as the Maltese hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the island of Malta. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to the Mediterranean climate. Ternstroemia maltbya is notable for its ornamental value and its role in the local flora of Malta.
